alert.note: Alert for Martin; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 12:28PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Lucie and eastern Martin Counties through 100 PM EST... At 1228 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Port Salerno, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Port Saint Lucie, Walton, Fort Pierce, Stuart and Tequesta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
